title: Rosecrans runs by River View
text:
Rosecrans runs by River View Cameron Teague Robinson , Reporter 12:26 a.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Buy Photo River View's Ethan Gulliams carries the ball against Rosecrans Friday night at Zanesville High School. The Bishops beat the Black Bears 28-0. (Photo: Chris Crook/Gannett Ohio, Chris Crook/Gannett Ohio) Buy Photo CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ZANESVILLE — Bishop Rosecrans head coach Mark Johnston was asked by a member of his coaching staff if he thought running back Travis Johnston could handle 40 carries Friday night despite being 80 percent healthy. 
He didn’t quite hit 40, but his 37 carries led to 226 yards and four touchdowns, which carried the Bishops (2-6) to a 28-0 win against River View (1-7), Friday night. 
"I don't know if we will give it to (Travis) that much, but honestly we made a few changes on the offensive line this week. We moved some people around, which gave us a little more mass and moved people a little better," Mark Johnston said. "Good game plan and it worked." 
Travis knew he was going to get the bulk of the carries today as usual. 
"I knew it was going to be a dogfight," Travis said. "I didn't know what the outcome would be, but I knew I would be getting the ball a lot." 
Everybody on the Rosecrans sideline knew the game plan and so did everybody on the River View sideline, but the Black Bears inability to tackle and shed blocks did them in. 
"They didn't do anything we didn't expect," River View coach Bob Forgave said. "But our kids have a hard time handling the pressure when they are supposed to win a game." 
"We didn't tackle, we weren't physical. It was the same reasons we couldn't move the ball, we couldn't block," he added. 
The Black Bears totaled 124 yards of total offense and their best drive of the game came late in the second half. It looked as if River View would be able to put points on the board before the half time break, but a fumble ended that drive. Buy Photo 
Rosecrans' Travis Johnston splits a pair of River View defenders Friday night at Zanesville High School. The Bishops beat the Black Bears 28-0. (Photo: Chris Crook/Times Recorder, Chris Crook/Times Recorder) 
But it sparked a scoring drive for the Bishops. They recovered it and turned that turnover into a touchdown of their own with 40 seconds left on the clock. 
"That touchdown really lifted everyone up," Travis Johnston said. 
The Bishops led 7-0 at halftime, but they remembered giving up 49 points in the second half to Marietta last week Travis said. 
"We knew we couldn't do that again and we had to get picked up," he added. 
The Bishops picked it up putting 21 points on the scoreboard in the second half. River View on the other hand, continued to struggle moving the ball on the ground. 
Quarterbacks Caden Croft and Keith Stewart combined for 103 passing yards, but Forgave said they need to be able to run the ball more effectively. 
The Black Bears will travel to Zanesville next week, as Rosecrans will travel to Meadowbrook. Buy Photo River View's Casey Turnbull carries the ball against Rosecrans. Chris Crook/Gannett Ohio
